dict.string: To begin, the entire list is targeted. A number in the list is randomly chosen. This number is called the "pivot".
This time, for convenience, the middle number is chosen as the pivot.
A left marker is placed on the leftmost number, and a right marker is placed on the rightmost number of the list.
The left marker keeps moving to the right until it reaches a number greater than or equal to the pivot number.
Now, it reaches number "3" which is equal to the pivot number, so it stops moving.
Then, it is the turn for the right marker to move left.
It also keep moving until it reaches a number less than or equal to the pivot number.
Since it reaches number "1" which is less than the pivot number, it stops moving.
Now, both left and right markers have stopped moving.
The two numbers, that are pointed by left and right markers, are swapped.
After swapping, the left marker moves to the next right number, and the right marker moves to the next left number.
Then, the left marker starts moving again to the right to find the number greater than or equal to the pivot number.
The left marker already pointed at number "5" which is greater than "3", so it stops moving.
Now, the right marker has the turn to move left.
In this case, the right marker is pointing at the pivot.
That means no comparision is needed and the right marker doesn't need to move.
Both left and right markers have stopped moving.
Again, the left marker's number is swapped with the right marker's number.
After swapping, the left marker moves to the next right number, and the right marker moves to the next left number.
This time, left and right markers move passing each other. That means the original list is dividided into two sub-lists.
The left sub-list is the group of numbers less than or equal to the pivot number "3".
The right sub-list is the group of number greater than or equal to the pivot number "3".
Now, the left sub-list is targeted. Again, the middle number is chosen as the pivot number.
The left marker points at the leftmost number which is "2", and the right marker points at the rightmost number of the sub-list which is "3".
The operation, that was used for the entire list, is used again for this sub-list.
The same operation is repeated until the number of elements in the sub-list is one.
The same operation is repeated until the number of elements in the sub-list is one.
The same operation is repeated until the number of elements in the sub-list is one.
The same operation is repeated until the number of elements in the sub-list is one.
Then, the same operations is used again for the next sub-list.
The same operations are repeated until all of the numbers are fully sorted
The same operations are repeated until all of the numbers are fully sorted
The same operations are repeated until all of the numbers are fully sorted
The same operations are repeated until all of the numbers are fully sorted
The same operations are repeated until all of the numbers are fully sorted
The same operations are repeated until all of the numbers are fully sorted
